required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vaginal Isonicotinic Acid Hydrazide Administration Prior to Intrauterine Device Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Benefits of Self-administered Vaginal Isonicotinic Acid Hydrazide (INH) Administration 12 Hours Prior to Intrauterine Device Insertion in Adolescent and Young Women: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate whether vaginal isonicotinic acid hydrazide administered before the levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system insertion reduces IUD insertion pain and difficulty in insertion in adolescents and young women.

detailed_description.textblock: Long-acting reversible contraception methods are highly effective methods for reduction of the unplanned pregnancy rate worldwide. The intrauterine device is a single procedure that provides reliable, effective and long term contraception for many women. However, the insertion procedure can be associated with a troublesome degree of pain that prevent some women from choosing its use. Different interventions have been described to decrease pain perception during intrauterine device insertion with no agreement on an effective one.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The difference in pain scores during intrauterine device insertion
primary_outcome.description: The difference in pain scores during intrauterine device insertion using visual analog scale from 0 to 10

secondary_outcome.description: duration of IUD insertion measured in minutes
Provider ease of insertion was evaluated using a visual analog scale from 0 to 10 cm where 0 denotes very easy insertion and 10 denotes a very difficult insertion.

arm_group.description: 3 vaginal tablet of isonicotinic acid hydrazide self-inserted by the patient 12 hours before IUD insertion.
3 tablet of placebo self-administered by the patient 12 hours before IUD insertion

intervention.description: 3 vaginal tablet of isonicotinic acid hydrazide self-inserted by the patient 12 hours before IUD insertion.
3 tablet of placebo self-inserted by the patient 12 hours before IUD insertion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- nulliparous adolescent and young women requesting levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine device
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy and
- contraindication or allergy to or contraindication to IUD insertion,
- chronic pelvic pain,
- pelvic inflammatory disease,
- analgesic intake 24 hours prior to IUD insertion.
